articles.author: Philip Blenkinsop
articles.description: The European Union wants to engage swiftly with the United States over President Donald Trump's planned tariffs, trade chief Maros Sefcovic said on Tuesday, while his boss Ursula von der Leyen stressed the bloc would protect its interests in negotiations.
articles.title: EU wants early US talks to avert Trump tariffs

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Kevin Huang
articles.description: China on Tuesday slapped tariffs on U.S. imports in a rapid response to new U.S. duties on Chinese goods, renewing a trade war between the world's top two economies as President Donald Trump sought to punish China for not halting the flow of illicit drugs.
articles.title: China hits back with tariffs on US goods after Trump imposes new levies

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: After Russia's 2022 invasion, Ukraine's normally febrile political life was becalmed under martial law. But there have been growing signs of activity picking up, as the United States has set its sights on finishing the war with Russia quickly.
articles.title: Ukraine's politics warms up as US focuses on war's endgame

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Maya Gebeily, Khalil Ashawi
articles.description: The discussions in Ankara will include establishing Turkish airbases in central Syria and training for Syria's new army.
articles.title: Exclusive: Syria's Sharaa to discuss defense pact with Turkey's Erdogan, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Swedish police said on Tuesday five people were shot in an attack at a school for adults in the city of Orebro some 200 km (125 miles) west of Stockholm, triggering a massive response by rescue services.
articles.title: Five people shot in attack at Swedish school, police say

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick, Steve Holland
articles.description: When Benjamin Netanyahu meets U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday, the Israeli prime minister is expected to try to turn the page on sometimes tense relations with the Biden White House as the two leaders address the future of the Gaza ceasefire and ways to counter Iran.
articles.title: Trump and Netanyahu set for pivotal talks on Middle East agenda

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The trial of the man charged with attempting to murder the novelist Salman Rushdie at a New York lecture is due to begin on Tuesday with jury selection.
articles.title: Trial of man in Salman Rushdie stabbing begins with jury selection

articles.author: Ceyda Caglayan
articles.description: Syrian transitional President Ahmed al-Sharaa was discussing economic ties on a visit to Turkey on Tuesday, as Turkish transport and manufacturing firms eye big expansion plans for Syria in what some expect will be a tripling of trade.
articles.title: Turkish firms pursue ambitious plans in rebuilding of Syria's economy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France's government welcomed new data showing that deportations of migrants increased by more than a quarter last year, as it tries to curb immigration to contain a surge in far-right support.
articles.title: France's government welcomes rise in deportations as it tries to stave off far right

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum on Tuesday dismissed the announcement from Ecuador's president a day earlier to apply tariffs on Mexican goods, noting that her country's trade with Ecuador represents a tiny share of exports.
articles.title: Mexican president shrugs off Ecuador tariff announcement
